titleStmt.title: Gädlä Qirqos "Vita of Cyricus" / Täʾamrä Qirqos "Miracles of Cyricus"

publicationStmt.publisher: Die Schriftkultur des christlichen Äthiopiens: Eine multimediale Forschungsumgebung / beta maṣāḥǝft

availability.licence: This file is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0.

msItem.title: Täʾamrä Qirqos “Miracles of Cyriacus”
msItem.rubric: Names of the protagonists; names of the scribe and donors. 8 lines, divided into four groups of two lines each, in the incipit page of Text I; incipit of Text II. The trinitarian formula throughout Text I. Some important passages in Text I. The first two lines of each miracle in Text II. Elements of the punctuation sign; element of Erhiopic numerals.
msItem.incipit:
Fol. 73va, l. 22 (Miracle 1): በስመ፡”… ንዌጥን፡ በረድኤተ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ መጽሐፈ፡ ተአምሪሁ፡ ለብፁዕ፡ ወለቅዱስ፡ ሰማዕት፡ [fol. 73vb] ቂርቆስ፡ ወልደ፡ ቅድስት፡ ኢየሉጣ፡ በረከቱ፡ የሃሉ፡ ም[ስለ]፡ ገብሩ፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፨፨ ስምዑ፡ ንንግርክሙ፡ ዘገብረ፡ ተአ[fol. 74ra]ምረ፡ ወመንክረ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ በዕለተ፡ ልደቱ፡ ወነበረ፡ ፩ብእሲ፡…
Fol. 73va, l.22 (Miracle 1): In the name of the father and of the Son and of the Holy Spirit, one God, we start, with the help of the Lord, the book of the miracles of blessed and St. martyr Cyricus, son of St. Julitta. May his blessing be with his servant. For ever and ever, amen. Listen, we will tell you how St. Cyricus made miracles and wonders on the day of his birth. And there was a man who was possessed by a demon...
msItem.explicit: Fol. 94rb, l.2 (Miracle 45): …ወቤቱ፡ ለውእቱ፡ ሠራቂ፡ ውስተ፡ ፩መካን፡ ውእቱ፡ ጥቃ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያኑ፡ ለቅዱስ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ ወልደ፡ ቅድስት፡ ኢየሉጣ፡ ጸሎቱ፡ ወበረከቱ፡ የዓሉ፡ ምስለ፡ ገብሩ፡ እኁነ፡ ገ[ብ]ረ፡ መድኅን፡ ወለ[ተ]፡ እግዚአ፡ ኃረያ፡ ወምስለ፡ ዓመቱ፡ ወለ[ተ]፡ ማርያም፡ ወምስለ፡ አግብርቲሁ፡ አቡነ፡ ተስፋ፡ ሚካኤል፡ ወምስለ፡ ጸሐፊሁ፡ ኀጥእ፡ ወአባሲ፡ ገብረ፡ ሕይወት፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፨ አሜን፨ ወአሜን፡ ለይኩን፨ ለይኩን፨Fol. 94rb, l.2 (Miracle 45): …and the house of that thief was in a place near the church of St. Cyricus, son of St. Julitta. May his prayer and his blessing be with his servant, our brother Gäbrä Mädḫən, Wälä[tta] ˀƎgziˀu Ḫaräya, with his maid Wälä[tta] Maryam and his servants ˀabunä Täsfay Mikaˀel, and with his scribe, sinful and impious Gäbrä Ḥəywät. For ever and ever, amen and amen. So be it, so be it.

listBibl.bibl: (EMML II, 4; Church of St. Raphael, quarter of Guläle, Addis Abäba).
(EMML II, 364; Church of Qirqos, quarter of Boleʾ, Addis Abäba).
(EMML VIII, 283-284; Church of Šäwa Meda Qirqos, Gubbalafto, Yäğğu, Wallo).
(EMML X, 324; Church of Däse Mädḫane ʿAläm, Wallo).

msItem.title: Gädlä Qirqos "Vita of Cyricus”
msItem.rubric: Names of the protagonists; names of the scribe and donors. 8 lines, divided into four groups of two lines each, in the incipit page of Text I; incipit of Text II. The trinitarian formula throughout Text I. Some important passages in Text I. The first two lines of each miracle in Text II. Elements of the punctuation sign; element of Erhiopic numerals.
msItem.incipit: Fol. 4ra: በስመ፡”…ገድል፡ ወስምዕ፡ ዘቅዱስ፡ ወብፁዕ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ ሰማዕት፡ወዘእሙ፡ ኢየሉጣ፡ ወዘካልዓን፡ ፼ወ፲፻፴ወ፬ሰማዕታት፡ እለ፡ ተከለሉ፡ በመዋዕለ፡ እለ፡ እስክንድሮስ፡ መኰንን፡ ወኮነ፡ እንከ፡ ሰደት፡ ዓቢይ፡ ውስተ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ዘክርስቶስ፨Fol. 4ra: In the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Spirit, one God, (this is) the life and the martyrdom of saint and blessed Cyricus ( martyr), and of his mother Julitta and of other 11,134 martyrs who were crowned in the time of the Governor Alexander. And then, there was a big persecution in the church of Christ.
msItem.explicit:
Fol. 73vb, l.13: …ወዘንተ፡ ብሂላ፡ ቦአት፡ ውስተ፡ ገነተ፡ ትፍሥሕት፨ ወወሀብዋ፡ ኪዳነ፡ አብ፡ ወወልድ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ዘገብረ፡ ተዝካራ፡ ወዘሐነጸ፡ መርጡላ፡ እስከ፡ ፲ወ፭ትውልድ፡ ወገድላኒ፡ ጽሑፍ፡ ምስለ፡ ወልዳ፨ ጸሎታ፡ ወበረታ፡ የሃለ፡ ም[ስለ]፡ ዓመታ፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለ[ም]፡ አሜን፨
Fol. 73vb, l.13: …And having said this, (she) entered the garden of joy. And the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit gave her the Covenant for the one who made her commemoration and built her sanctuary, until the 15th generation. And her gädl is written with (that of) her son. May her prayer and her blessing be with her servant. For ever and ever, amen.

8 ፭V(8; s.l.: 3, stub after 6; 6, stub after 3/fols. 36r-43v)

layout.ab: On average, 24 lines. On different folios, 24-25 lines.
Structural pricks are partly visible (s. fols. 32r, 33r).
The upper line is written above the ruling.
The bottom line is written above the ruling.

list.item: - Short line with dots above and below (esp. fols. 7rb, l.23; 12va, l.21).
II. - Four dot asterisk (esp. fols. 9ra, l.22; 15va, ls. 8, 22, 23, 24;16ra, l.23; 16rb, l.24; 22ra, l.12; 29vb, l.19; 36rb, l.25; 74rb, l.21).
- Nine dot asterisk (used throughout the text).
- Doubled nine red dot asterisks (esp. 73vb, l.24).
- Nine dot asterisks, connected with lines (esp. fol. 66vb, l.25).

decoDesc.decoNote: Fol. 73v: simple ornamental band, separating Text I and Text II (geometric motifs).

binding.decoNote: Two wooden boards covered with reddish-brown tooled leather. Two pairs of sewing stations.
Two pairs of chains of endband stitches at the spine cover.

projectDesc.p: Encoded according to TEI P5 Guidelines.

person.persName: Several names are mentioned in the supplication formula on fol. 94rb: Gäbrä Mädḫǝn, Wälätta ʾƎgziʾ Ḫaräyä, Wälätta Maryam, ʾabunä Täsfa Mikaʾel.
